paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the KCNH2 gene variant c.3017delG (G1006fs/49) associated with long QT syndrome type II, detailing its clinical significance, penetrance data, and functional studies.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Cardiac arrest due to ventricular fibrillation
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The proband (subject II‐3) aged 23 years, after sudden awakening from sleep following a loud noise (her brother's intense crying), suffered from cardiac arrest due to ventricular fibrillation resuscitated by transthoracic DC shock.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Syncope with fall to the ground associated with trauma to the right cheekbone
individual_records.evidence_sentence: During the same night, her brother (subject III‐5, aged 11 years) experienced syncope (with fall to the ground associated with trauma to the right cheekbone).
All mutant carriers were treated with β‐blocker therapy (nadolol).
All mutant carriers were treated with β‐blocker therapy (nadolol).
All mutant carriers were treated with β‐blocker therapy (nadolol).

functional_data.summary: The G1006fs/49 variant causes a translational frame shift and premature protein termination, leading to altered biophysical properties of the KCNH2 channel.

variants.segregation_data: The genetic screening has been performed in five family members and all of them resulted positive for the mutation.
variants.additional_notes: The variant is associated with a significant risk of cardiac events in affected individuals.
key_quotes: The mutation consists of the G deletion at position 3017 in the KCNH2 coding region, causing both a translational frame shift starting from the glycine 1006 and a premature protein termination 49 amino acids forward.
The clinical features co‐segregating with the G1006fs/49 variant are collected in the Table S1.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
